description: In the VELUX Group, we offer you a world of opportunities and the chance to create a bright future. From the forefront of the sustainable indoor living industry, we enable those who live, work and play under the roof transform their spaces and live a healthier everyday life with more daylight and fresh air. The VELUX Group is an international, family-owned business with strong financial roots and each year we are able to create real impact by reinvesting in society, our employees and planet through our foundations. Alongside the rest of our values, “courage” and “mutual respect” define our actions every day and how we wish to contribute to the world. The primary purpose of this position is to manage all field sales efforts within the South x West region. The ideal location for this position will be in California. This includes the Pacific Northwest, Southwest, and Southeast Districts. The position will report directly to the Director of Sales. Specifically: Responsible for achieving regional sales objectives. Manages 5 direct reports (3 District Sales Managers, 2 Installer Bus. Dev. Mgr) and indirectly up to 28 field sales personnel Successfully creates the right Growth mindset within the Region Identify Growth opportunities and create a strategy to capture it Successfully implements sales strategies Responsible for development of sales personnel. Build relationships with VELUX customers. Possible National Account Management of large customers Primary Responsibilities: Developing and implementing annual sales force strategy. Successfully recruit, build out, and develop our Installer partners. This includes managing an Installer Business Development team focused on the Skylight Specialist network Develop and implement a builder strategy in the region to increase skylight penetration within this customer segment Develop a plan to aggressively attack low share markets and earn the business Working with and supporting pilots within the Region even though personnel may not report within the Region Directing all sales efforts within the South x West Region towards achieving budgeted sales goals. Participates with People & Organization in recruiting, training and developing the field sales personnel. Preparing annual sales forecasts and sales expense estimates. Operating within established expense budget. Monitors sales results and redirects sales efforts accordingly. Building relationships with customers, providing VELUX a competitive advantage in the market. Provide feedback to the Director of Sales as to improvements in policies, procedures, products and other business issues. Monthly Salary Range: $12,190.00 (minimum) - $15,240 (midpoint). Compensation will be based on the skills and experience of the candidate. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree required. Willing and able to travel. Should spend 50% of time in the field on sales rides and customer visits throughout the South x West Region. This will mean between 75 and 100 travel nights a year A minimum of five years of sales management experience is required. High energy and enthusiasm. Cheerleader, coach, motivator, mentor. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written. Strong leadership, employee development and interviewing skills. Excellent decision making and problem-solving skills. Demonstration of the ability to take initiative. Must possess strong planning, prioritizing and goal setting skills. Demonstration of the ability to coach and motivate others. Candidates must desire working in a team environment, be dependable and demonstrate a high degree of loyalty and personal integrity. Ability to perform the essential functions assigned to the position. Compliance with all rules of conduct, safety regulations and policies provided in Employee Handbooks, on Company bulletin boards/announcements, terms/conditions of employment or other means of communication is a requirement of the position. Our ambition of treating employees better than most other companies includes the challenging work environment we strive to create as well as the competitive benefit programs available to employees and their dependents upon joining the Company. Some of these include: Competitive Salary Sales Incentive Programs Company Vehicle Company Matched 401(k) Retirement Plan Vacation Day Program Sick Day Program Service Recognition Program Educational Assistance Program Group Health Insurance Plan Dental Plan Vision Care Plan Prescription Drug Card Program Long-term Disability Short-term Disability Life Insurance Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Cancer Protection Plan Flexible Spending Accounts Equal Opportunity Employer VELUX is fully committed to the concept and practice of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. To further our goal of equal employment opportunity for all employees and prospective employees, it is the policy of VELUX to recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, sexual orientation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. All employment decisions shall be consistent with the principle of equal employment opportunity and only job-related qualifications will be required. E-Verify VELUX uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify. For more than 80 years, The VELUX Group has created better living environments for people around the world; making the most of daylight and fresh air through the roof. Our product programme includes roof windows and modular skylights, decorative blinds, sun screening products and roller shutters, as well as installation and smart home solutions. These products help to ensure a healthy and sustainable indoor climate, for work and learning, for play and pleasure. We work globally – with sales and manufacturing operations in more than 38 countries and around 12,500 employees worldwide. The VELUX Group is owned by VKR Holding A/S, a limited company wholly owned by non-profit, charitable foundations (THE VELUX FOUNDATIONS) and family. In 2021, VKR Holding had total revenue of EUR 3.5 billion and THE VELUX FOUNDATIONS donated EUR 244 million in charitable grants.
